thread.title: Royals' Alcides Escobar wins ALCS MVP
thread.title_full: Royals' Alcides Escobar wins ALCS MVP

title: Royals' Alcides Escobar wins ALCS MVP
text:
Royals' Alcides Escobar wins ALCS MVP Shortstop went 11-for-23 in 6-game series   01:13:36   04:  
Kansas City Royals shortstop and leadoff hitter Alcides Escobar was named the MVP   on Friday. 
On top of his usual defensive contributions, Escobar set a postseason record by getting a leadoff hit in the first four games of a series. He went 11-for-23 in the ALCS, which the Royals clinched after a Game 6 win over the Toronto Blue Jays. 
The Royals, who advance to their second consecutive World Series, will be gunning to win this time when it opens Tuesday against the New York Mets. Related Content
